The invention of the printing press: I would change the invention of the printing press from Johannes Gutenberg in 1440 to the creation of the internet in the 1960s. This change would have revolutionized the way information is disseminated and accessed, making it much easier for people to access knowledge and ideas from around the world.

The assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand: I would change the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand in Sarajevo in 1914 to a peaceful resolution of the conflict between Austria-Hungary and Serbia. This change would have prevented World War I and saved countless lives.

The discovery of penicillin: I would change the discovery of penicillin by Alexander Fleming in 1928 to the discovery of a cure for cancer. This change would have revolutionized medicine and saved millions of lives.

The invention of the telephone: I would change the invention of the telephone by Alexander Graham Bell in 1876 to the creation of the internet. This change would have revolutionized communication and made it much easier for people to connect with each other around the world.

The signing of the Magna Carta: I would change the signing of the Magna Carta in 1215 to a more comprehensive document that protected individual rights and established the rule of law. This change would have laid the foundation for modern democracy and human rights.
